perturbation.original_text: Turpin agrees to maintain at all times adequate and current records relating to the creation and development of the Work Product and Intellectual Property Rights therein, which records and all copies thereof shall be and shall remain the exclusive property of the Company, and to disclose all such records and copies to the Company promptly.
perturbation.changed_text: Turpin will endeavor to maintain records relating to the creation and development of the Work Product and Intellectual Property Rights therein, and will aim to disclose these records and copies to the Company when feasible.
perturbation.explanation: The change from "agrees to maintain at all times adequate and current records" to "will endeavor to maintain records" weakens the obligation. Similarly, replacing "shall be and shall remain the exclusive property of the Company, and to disclose all such records and copies to the Company promptly" with "will aim to disclose these records and copies to the Company when feasible" introduces significant ambiguity and makes the obligation discretionary. This contradicts the implied duty of good faith and fair dealing, which requires parties to act honestly and reasonably in performing their contractual obligations. The added ambiguity makes the legal obligation almost impossible to enforce.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied Duty of Good Faith and Fair Dealing

perturbation.original_text: Turpin shall, at the Company's request, assist with, execute and deliver all further documents, applications, declarations, verifications, submissions, transfers and assignments and do all other things requested by the Company, acting reasonably, during the term hereof and thereafter, at the expense of the Company, but without additional compensation, to enable the Company or its nominees to apply for, acquire, prosecute, perfect, enforce and/or maintain any and all right, title and interest, in any country, in and to the Confidential Information, the Work Product and the Intellectual Property Rights in same.
perturbation.changed_text: Turpin should, within reason, assist with documents the Company needs, but is not obligated to execute or deliver them if it causes undue burden to Turpin.
perturbation.explanation: The original text imposes a clear obligation on Turpin to assist with legal documents. The modified text changes "Turpin shall" to "Turpin should, within reason", weakening the obligation. Adding "but is not obligated to execute or deliver them if it causes undue burden to Turpin" introduces significant ambiguity and subjectivity, making it difficult to enforce. What constitutes an 'undue burden' is open to interpretation. This change undermines the company's ability to protect its Intellectual Property Rights.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied Duty of Good Faith and Fair Dealing

perturbation.original_text: Turpin shall deliver to the Company all Work Product and Company Property, including all originals and copies thereof, in Turpin's possession and/or control, at the request of the Company, or, in the absence of such a request, upon the termination of Turpin's employment with the Company.
perturbation.changed_text: Turpin will attempt to return Work Product and Company Property when practical, provided that he has no further need for them and it does not interfere with his subsequent employment.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states that Turpin *shall* deliver all Work Product. The revised text changes this to "Turpin will attempt to return Work Product when practical." This weakens the obligation. Adding "provided that he has no further need for them and it does not interfere with his subsequent employment" introduces significant ambiguity and conflicts with the company's ownership of intellectual property. It allows Turpin to potentially retain company property based on subjective needs and future employment conflicts, undermining the company's control over its assets.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Property Law Principles (Ownership and Control of Assets)
